sinks.name: TEE_CipherInit
sinks.reason: Adversary-controlled IV/nonce can undermine cipher security (e.g., IV reuse/predictability

sinks.name: TEE_CipherInit
sinks.reason: Adversary-controlled IV length can cause improper initialization or mode misuse; if not validated, could also trigger internal copy/read issues.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Tainted size can cause integer overflow/under-allocation leading to subsequent buffer overflows, or excessive allocation/DoS

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Tainted attribute array pointer may lead to parsing of attacker-controlled pointers/sizes and copying into internal buffers

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Tainted attribute count may cause over-iteration or malformed parsing leading to memory issues

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Destination pointer may point to shared or unintended memory; writing to it can corrupt shared memory or internal memory if tainted/unchecked.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size controls how many bytes are written; tainted/unchecked size can cause out-of-bounds writes or corruption, including in shared memory.
